article.headline: Nicholls St. 73, Lamar 61
article.story: THIBODAUX, La. -- Anatoly Bose scored 22 points to help Nicholls State defeat Lamar 73-61 on Saturday and clinch the eighth and final berth in the Southland Conference tournament. The Colonels (11-18, 7-9) will face top seed Sam Houston State in the first round Wednesday in Katy, Texas. Lamar (14-18, 5-11) ended the season with its seventh consecutive loss. Nicholls State trailed 23-22 at halftime but outscored the Cardinals 12-2 in the opening 4:49 of the second half. Lamar got back within two, 51-49, at the 7-minute mark, but the Colonels regained control down the stretch, taking a 65-56 lead when Bose hit a 3-pointer with a hand in his face with 1:24 left. Fred Hunter scored 17 points and Chris Iles had 13 points and five assists for the Colonels. Justin Nabors scored 14 points and Kendrick Harris added 13 to lead Lamar.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
